intro: Ptilotus polakii subsp. juxta, commonly known as the "desert everlasting" or "fairy daisies," is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a compact, low-growing habit with hairy foliage, which helps it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils. This subspecies is often found in coastal dunes and inland deserts, showcasing its adaptability to extreme conditions.
